alert.note: Alert for Middlesex (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 10:19PM EST until further notice by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Massachusetts...Connecticut... Connecticut River At Montague affecting Franklin and Hampshire Counties. Connecticut River At Northampton affecting Hampden and Hampshire Counties. Connecticut River At Thompsonville affecting Hartford and Hampden Counties. Connecticut River At Hartford affecting Middlesex and Hartford Counties. Connecticut River At Middle Haddam affecting Middlesex County. For the Connecticut River...including Montague, Middle Haddam, Northampton, Hartford, Thompsonville...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Connecticut River at Middle Haddam. * WHEN...From Tuesday morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 10.5 feet, Flooding continues to overspread sections of Portland and Middletown, as well as downstream towns including Chester and Essex. Some immediate river roads will be impassable. In Cromwell this usually impacts portions of River Road. In Rocky Hill, portions of Meadow Road will become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:55 PM EST Monday the stage was 6.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 7.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall to 6.5 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to 10.9 feet early Thursday morning. It will fall to 10.8 feet early Thursday morning. It will then rise to 10.9 feet late Thursday morning. It will fall again but remain above flood stage. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.4 feet on 07/13/2023. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday afternoon at noon EST.
